Welcome to Symboard’s documentation!¶

Symboard settings¶

symboard.settings.DEFAULT_OUTPUT_PATH = './a.keylayout'¶

If no output path is specified, the keylayout will default to being written to the path specified by DEFAULT_OUTPUT_PATH. This string can, but does not need to, end in «.keylayout».

symboard.settings.VERSION = '0.1'¶

The current version of symboard being used, equivalent to a string <major_version>.<minor_version>

Symboard main¶

symboard.main.get_arg_parser() → argparse.ArgumentParser¶
Returns

An ArgumentParser instance which will parse the

arguments provided to Symboard when executed from the command line.

Return type

ArgumentParser

symboard.main.main() → None¶

The main method (entry point) for symboard. This function parses the input arguments, and calls the orchestrator to handle the execution of Symboard with respect to these arguments.

Symboard orchestrator¶

class symboard.orchestrator.Orchestrator¶

A class which defines one method («run»). This method defines and controls the execution of Symboard given the parameters with which Symboard was called.

run(input_path: str, output_path: str) → None¶

This method defines and controls the execution of Symboard given the parameters with which Symboard was called. it will parse the given input file, create a keylayout according to that spec, and write this keylayout as an XML file to the specified output path.

Parameters

  • input_path (str) – The path to the file containing the specification from which to create a keylayout.

  • output_path (str) – The path to which the output keylayout is to be written.

Symboard errors¶

exception symboard.errors.BaseSymboardException(msg: str = '')¶

A generic exception which can be thrown when some other exception does not accurately describe the problem, and should be inherited from by all other exceptions used by the Symboard program.

exception symboard.errors.FileExistsException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates that the file to be written to already exists, and so cannot be written to.

exception symboard.errors.KeylayoutNoneException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates a keylayout is None, but was expected not to be.

exception symboard.errors.NoneException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates that one of the variables in the program is None, but was expected not to be.

exception symboard.errors.NotAFileException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates that the file to be parsed does not exist or is not a file.

exception symboard.errors.ParserException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates that something has gone wrong when parsing.

exception symboard.errors.WriteException(msg: str = '')¶

Indicates that something has gone wrong when writing to file.

Symboard file_writers¶

class symboard.file_writers.FileWriter¶

The base class for functions which write to the local file system.

Any classes which inherit from this class should have a custom implementation of «write».

write(object_, output_path: str = './a.keylayout') → None¶

A generic implementation of writing to file, which should be implemented by the children of this class.

Parameters

  • object_ (object) – The object we want to write data from.

  • output_path (str) – The path of the file we want to write to. Defaults to DEFAULT_OUTPUT_PATH.

class symboard.file_writers.KeylayoutFileWriter¶
contents(keylayout: symboard.keylayouts.keylayouts.Keylayout) → str¶

A generic implementation of getting the contents of a keylayout, which should be implemented by the children of this class.

Parameters

keylayout (Keylayout) – The keylayout we want to get the contents of.

Returns

’’

Return type

str

write(keylayout: symboard.keylayouts.keylayouts.Keylayout, output_path: str = './a.keylayout') → None¶

Given an output file path, tries to create a file in that path using the contents of <keylayout>.

Parameters

  • keylayout (Keylayout) – The keylayout we want to write data from.

  • output_path (str) – The path of the file we want to write to. Defaults to DEFAULT_OUTPUT_PATH.

Raises

  • FileExistsException – If <output_path> already exists.

  • WriteException – If any error occurs while trying to create the

  • contents of <keylayout>, or to write the contents to file. –

class symboard.file_writers.KeylayoutXMLFileWriter¶
contents(keylayout: symboard.keylayouts.keylayouts.Keylayout) → str¶
Parameters

keylayout (Keylayout) – The keylayout we want to get the contents of.

Returns

The (formatted) contents of <keylayout>, in XML version 1.1, in a format that can be read and installed by macOS.

Return type

str

Raises

KeylayoutNoneException – If <keylayout> is None.

Symboard parsers¶

class symboard.parsers.FileParser¶

A generic implementation of a file parser which should be inherited from. It contains one method, «parse», which should be overwritten by children of this class.

static parse(file_path: str)¶

A generic implementation of file parsing which should be overwritten by children of this class.

Parameters

file_path (str) – The path of the file to parse.

class symboard.parsers.Parser¶

A generic implementation of a parser which should be inherited from. It contains one method («parse») which should be overwritten by children of this class.

static parse(content)¶

A generic implementation of parsing which should be overwritten by children of this class.

Parameters

content (object) – The content to parse.

class symboard.parsers.StringParser¶

A generic implementation of a string parser which should be inherited from. It contains one method, «parse», which should be overwritten by children of this class.

static parse(content: str)¶

A generic implementation of string parsing which should be overwritten by children of this class.

Parameters

content (str) – The string to parse.

class symboard.parsers.YamlFileParser¶

A file parser which parses yaml files, using the method «parse» as the exposed API function for parsing.

static parse(file_path: str) → Dict¶

An implementation of parsing yaml files.

Parameters

file_path (str) – The path of the yaml file to parse.

Returns

A dictionary containing the parsed data contained by the

specified yaml file.

Return type

Dict

Raises

  • ParserException – If the path does not exist or is not a file; or if

  • some other error occurs. –
